verses.verse: Woe<WH1945> to you, O destroyer,<WH7703> While you were not destroyed;<WH7703> And he who is treacherous,<WH898> while [others] did not deal<WH898> treacherously<WH898> with him. As soon as you shall finish<WH8552> destroying,<WH7703> you shall be destroyed;<WH7703> As soon as you shall cease<WH5239> to deal<WH898> treacherously,<WH898> [others] shall deal<WH898> treacherously<WH898> with you.

O Lord,<WH3068> be gracious<WH2603> to us; we have waited<WH6960> for Thee. Be Thou their strength<WH2220> every morning,<WH1242> Our salvation<WH3444> also<WH637> in the time<WH6256> of distress.<WH6869>
At the sound<WH6963> of the tumult<WH1995> peoples<WH5971> flee;<WH5074> At the lifting<WH7427> up of Thyself nations<WH1471> disperse.<WH9339>
And your spoil<WH7998> is gathered<WH622> [as] the caterpillar<WH2625> gathers;<WH625> As locusts<WH9069> rushing<WH4944> about,<WH4944> men rush<WH8264> about<WH8264> on it.
The Lord<WH3068> is exalted,<WH7682> for He dwells<WH7931> on high;<WH4791> He has filled<WH4390> Zion<WH6726> with justice<WH4941> and righteousness.<WH6666>
And He shall be the stability<WH530> of your times,<WH6256> A wealth<WH2633> of salvation,<WH3444> wisdom,<WH2451> and knowledge;<WH1847> The fear<WH3374> of the Lord<WH3068> is his treasure.<WH214>
Behold,<WH2005> their brave<WH691> men<WH691> cry<WH6817> in the streets,<WH2351> The ambassadors<WH4397> of peace<WH7965> weep<WH1058> bitterly.<WH4751>

The highways<WH4546> are desolate,<WH8074> the traveler<WH5674> has ceased,<WH7673> He has broken<WH6565> the covenant,<WH1285> he has despised<WH3988> the cities,<WH5892> He has no<WH3808> regard<WH2803> for man.<WH582>

The land<WH776> mourns<WH56> and pines<WH535> away,<WH535> Lebanon<WH3844> is shamed<WH2659> and withers;<WH7060> Sharon<WH8289> is like a desert<WH6160> plain,<WH6160> And Bashan<WH1316> and Carmel<WH3760> lose<WH5287> [their foliage.]
"Now<WH6258> I will arise,<WH6965>" says<WH559> the Lord,<WH3068> "Now<WH6258> I will be exalted,<WH7426> now<WH6258> I will be lifted<WH5375> up.
"You have conceived<WH2029> chaff,<WH2842> you will give<WH3205> birth<WH3205> to stubble;<WH7179> My breath<WH7307> will consume<WH398> you like a fire.<WH784>
"And the peoples<WH5971> will be burned<WH4955> to lime,<WH7875> Like cut<WH3683> thorns<WH6975> which are burned<WH3341> in the fire.<WH784>
"You who<WH7350> are far<WH7350> away,<WH7350> hear<WH8085> what<WH834> I have done;<WH6213> And you who<WH7138> are near,<WH7138> acknowledge<WH3045> My might.<WH1369>"

Sinners<WH2400> in Zion<WH6726> are terrified;<WH6342> Trembling<WH9564> has seized<WH270> the godless.<WH2611> "Who<WH4310> among us can live<WH1481> with the consuming<WH398> fire<WH784>? Who<WH4310> among us can live<WH1481> with continual<WH5769> burning<WH4168>?"

He who walks<WH1980> righteously,<WH6666> and speaks<WH1696> with sincerity,<WH4339> He who rejects<WH3988> unjust<WH1215> <WH4642> gain,<WH1215> And shakes<WH5287> his hands<WH3709> so<WH4480> that they hold<WH8551> no<WH4480> bribe;<WH7810> He who stops<WH331> his ears<WH241> from hearing<WH8085> about bloodshed,<WH1818> And shuts<WH9429> his eyes<WH5869> from looking<WH7200> upon evil;<WH9563>
He will dwell<WH7931> on the heights;<WH4791> His refuge<WH4869> will be the impregnable<WH4679> rock;<WH5553> His bread<WH3899> will be given<WH5414> [him;] His water<WH4325> will be sure.<WH539>
Your eyes<WH5869> will see<WH2372> the King<WH4428> in His beauty;<WH3308> They will behold<WH7200> a far-distant land.<WH776>
Your heart<WH3820> will meditate<WH1897> on terror:<WH367> "Where<WH346> is he who counts<WH5608>? Where<WH346> is he who weighs<WH8254>? Where<WH346> is he who counts<WH5608> the towers<WH4026>?"

You will no<WH3808> longer see<WH7200> a fierce<WH3267> people,<WH5971> A people<WH5971> of unintelligible<WH6012> speech<WH8193> which no<WH4480> one comprehends,<WH8085> Of a stammering<WH3932> tongue<WH3956> which no<WH369> one<WH369> understands.<WH998>

Look<WH2372> upon Zion,<WH6726> the city<WH7151> of our appointed<WH4150> feasts;<WH4150> Your eyes<WH5869> shall see<WH7200> Jerusalem<WH3389> an undisturbed<WH7600> habitation,<WH5116> A tent<WH168> which shall not be folded,<WH6813> Its stakes<WH3489> shall never<WH1077> <WH5331> be pulled<WH5265> up Nor<WH1077> any<WH3605> of its cords<WH9112> be torn<WH5423> apart.<WH5423>

But there<WH8033> the majestic<WH117> [One,] the Lord,<WH3068> shall be for us A place<WH4725> of rivers<WH5104> [and] wide<WH7342> canals,<WH2975> On which no<WH1077> boat<WH590> with oars<WH7885> shall go,<WH1980> And on which no<WH3808> mighty<WH117> ship<WH6716> shall pass<WH5674> –
For the Lord<WH3068> is our judge,<WH8199> The Lord<WH3068> is our lawgiver,<WH2710> The Lord<WH3068> is our king;<WH4428> He will save<WH3467> us –

Your tackle<WH9112> hangs<WH5203> slack;<WH5203> It cannot<WH1077> hold<WH2388> the base<WH3653> of its mast<WH8650> firmly,<WH2388> Nor<WH1077> spread<WH6566> out the sail.<WH5251> Then<WH227> the prey<WH5706> of an abundant<WH4766> spoil<WH7998> will be divided;<WH2505> The lame<WH6455> will take<WH962> the plunder.<WH957>
And no<WH1077> resident<WH7934> will say,<WH559> "I am sick<WH2470>"; The people<WH5971> who dwell<WH3427> there will be forgiven<WH5375> [their] iniquity.<WH5771>
